semantic_title: Level of Detail in Coding - Highest Number of Characters and Specificity Required
section_path: Section I > B. General Coding Guidelines > 2. Level of Detail in Coding

content.full_text: Diagnosis codes are to be used and reported at their highest number of characters available and to the highest level of specificity documented in the medical record. ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes are composed of codes with 3, 4, 5, 6 or 7 characters. Codes with three characters are included in ICD-10-CM as the heading of a category of codes that may be further subdivided by the use of fourth and/or fifth characters and/or sixth characters, which provide greater detail. A three-character code is to be used only if it is not further subdivided. A code is invalid if it has not been coded to the full number of characters required for that code, including the 7th character, if applicable. (Evidence: pg no: 12, L87-L95)
content.summary: Codes must be used at highest number of characters available and highest level of specificity documented, with invalid codes resulting from insufficient characters (Evidence: pg no: 12, L87-L95)
